name: Tanium REST
description: This app supports investigative and generic actions on Tanium

results_percentage.description: Consider question results complete at (% out of 100)

actions.description: Validate the asset configuration for connectivity using supplied configuration
List the running processes of the devices registered on the Tanium server
actions.verbose: This action requires specifying a sensor to be used to list processes. A standard Tanium sensor, 'Process Details' is used by default but a different sensor can be specified instead. Note that the 'Process Details' sensor may not be available on all Tanium deployments. Note that at this time this action only supports limiting the query to specified computer groups, but a generic Run Query action can be constructed to query an in individual computer's processes. As pagination is not implemented, the result(s) of the action will be the result(s) that are fetched in a single API call.

sensor.description: Sensor which will list all the processes

group_name.description: Computer group name of which the processes will be listed

timeout_seconds.description: The number of seconds before the question expires

actions.description: Parses the supplied text into a valid Tanium query string
actions.verbose:
When asked a non-saved question in the query_text parameter, it will parse the given query and give a list of suggestions that are related to it.

For example, on the Tanium platform, if one were to just ask the question, 'all IP addresses,' Tanium will give the suggestions:

  • Get Static IP Addresses from all machines
  • Get IP Routes from all machines
  • Get IP Address from all machines
  • Get IP Connections from all machines
  • Get IP Route Details from all machines
  • Get Network IP Gateway from all machines

Tanium sorts this list, from most-related to least-related.

example_values: Get Child Processes from all machines

actions.description: Retrieves either a history of the most recent questions or a list of saved questions
actions.verbose: If the list_saved_questions parameter is true, this action will return a list of saved questions. If the flag is not set, this action will return the history of recently asked questions. As pagination is not implemented, the result(s) of the action will be the result(s) that are fetched in a single API call.

example_values: Get Detect Tools Status from all machines with ( Detect Tools Status contains engine version and Detect Tools Status contains Unix )

actions.description: Kill a running process of the devices registered on the Tanium server

package_name.description: Package name that will be executed

package_parameters.description: Package parameters of the corresponding package

group_name.description: Computer group name of which the process will be terminated

distribute_seconds.description: The number of seconds over which to deploy the action

issue_seconds.description: The number of seconds to reissue an action from the saved action

expire_seconds.description: The duration from the start time before the action expires

actions.description: Execute an action on the Tanium server
actions.verbose:
• See top-level app documentation for example parameters.
  • If a parameterized package is used for executing an action all the parameters must be provided with correct and unique keys. If any key is repeated then the value of that key will be overwritten.
  • If the issue_seconds parameter is provided, then the action will respawn after a time interval provided in the issue_seconds parameter.

action_name.description: Creates a name for the action executed

package_name.description: Name of the Tanium package to be executed

package_parameters.description: Parameter inputs of the corresponding package. Provide JSON format (i.e. {"$1": "Standard_Collection", "$2": "SCP"})

group_name.description: The Tanium Computer Group name on which the action will be executed. If left blank, will execute on all registered IP addresses/hostnames in your Tanium instance

distribute_seconds.description: The number of seconds over which to deploy the action

issue_seconds.description: The number of seconds to reissue an action from the saved action

expire_seconds.description: The duration from the start time before the action expires

actions.description: Run a search query on the devices registered on the Tanium server
actions.verbose: See top-level app documentation for example parameters. For manual questions only, the action waits for timeout_seconds provided by the user in intervals of 5 seconds to fetch the results. The action is a success as soon as the results are retrieved or else it will timeout and fail. As pagination is not implemented, the result(s) of the action will be the result(s) that are fetched in a single API call.

query_text.description: Query to run (in Tanium Question Syntax)

group_name.description: The Tanium Computer Group name on which the query will be executed (manual query only)

is_saved_question.description: Check this box if the query text parameter refers to a 'Saved Question' on your Tanium

timeout_seconds.description: The number of seconds before the question expires (manual query only)

wait_for_results_processing.description: Flag to wait for endpoint to return full results
wait_for_results_processing.verbose: If an endpoint takes longer than usual to evaluate a sensor, it might initially supply the answer[current results unavailable] to the answer message that it passes along the linear chain and ultimately to the Tanium Server. However, the sensor process continues on the endpoint after supplying that initial answer and, upon completing the process, the endpoint sends its updated answer. Reference Link: ~https://docs.tanium.com/interact/interact/results.html

return_when_n_results_available.description: Return results as soon as 'n' answers are available

wait_for_n_results_available.description: Wait until 'n' results are present, even if hit the percent complete threshold

actions.description: Return the results for an already asked question
